page.title: 10LIFE ON A LOCAL FARM
page.content: I get up and get my breakfast and listen to the farming on Radio 2. Then at around 6.30am I go and feed the calves which takes about an hour. I go down to the other calves which have been weened and water and 'cake' them. I then go to the other farm and get the tractor with the drenching gear and take it down to the pens.I leave the tractor and gather in the sheep from the hills, and put them into the pens. After dinner I go to the pens and drench all the ewes and lambs. Then it is time to feed the calves again. After feeding both sets of calves it is time for tea and the end of the day.
